intro.description: This cheat sheet shows you the steps to merge changes from one CVS branch into another, or into HEAD. If you need help at any step, click on the (?) icon to the right.

item.title: Determine branch and version information
item.description: The first step is to decide which two branches will be merged, at which version the content was branched, and what the destination branch will be (where the result of the merge will go). Once you have this information, you can move on to the next step.

item.title: Check out the project
item.description: Before merging, you must check out the project you wish to merge and bring it into your workspace. You can do this either via the import wizard or by adding your repository from the CVS Repository Exploring perspective, or click the (?) button for help.

item.title: Load the destination into your workspace
item.description: In the navigator, right-click on the project and select Replace With > Another Branch or Version. Select the destination branch. This will load the branch's latest content into your workspace.

item.title: Merge details
item.description: Again in the navigator, right-click on the project and select Team > Merge and complete the steps in the wizard. In this wizard you specify the details of the merge.

item.title: Work with the Merge editor
item.description: In the Merge editor manually merge the changes. This step loads the required changes into the workspace. Once you've merged all the changes and are satisfied with the result, move on to the next step.

item.title: Commit your changes
item.description: Right-click on the project and select Team > Synchronize with Repository and then commit all the changes to the repository. This step finalizes the transfer of the changes from the workspace to the CVS repository, and finalizes the merge.
